configuration.name: Configuration

props.name: log
props.description: Used to Log Messages.

props.name: info
props.description: Information About the Bot.

props.name: cooldowns
props.description: Cooldown Settings of the Bot.

props.name: prefixes
props.description: Array of Prefixes that the Bot uses.

props.name: reportErrors
props.description: Determines whether even the Smallest of Errors should be Reported or Not.

props.name: commandsDirectory
props.description: The Path of the Directory where the Commands are saved.

props.name: custom
props.description: Used to set Custom Properties under the Bot.

params.name: config
params.description: The Object that holds all Configuration Instructions.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Performs all of the Pre-Processing Tasks and Logs in the Bot.

classes.name: SenseiCommand
classes.description: Represents a Command that can be executed by [SenseiClient](SenseiClient.html).

construct.name: SenseiCommand
construct.description: Creates a new SenseiCommand Object that can be used by a [SenseiClient](SenseiClient.html). All of the Properties Above need to be Defined in the Constructor of a Class that Extends this class.

props.name: log
props.description: Used to Log Messages.

props.name: names
props.description: The Array of Names of the Command.

props.name: category
props.description: The Category this Command Belongs to.

props.name: info
props.description: The Name, Description and Syntax of the Command.

props.name: cooldown
props.description: The Cooldown Duration of this Command (If Applicable)

props.name: arguments
props.description: The Arguments that are required by this Command.

methods.name: run
methods.description: The Code to be Executed when this Command is called by a Discord User. This Method needs to be Defined by the User inside a Command Class that Extends this SenseiCommand class.
examples: // Here's how this method may be defined in a Command:async run(bot, message, args) {     let sender = message.author.username;     let channel = message.channe;     channel.send(`Hello ${sender}!. How are you doing ?`);     return;}

params.name: args
params.description: The Arguments this message was sent with.

methods.name: reportError
methods.description: This Method is used for Error Reporting (To the Discord User)

params.name: messages
params.description: An array of messages to be included in the error.

classes.name: Logger
classes.description: A Class used for Logging Stuff to the Console. Can be used by Anyone, although its main usage is to Log Messages from the Other Classes.

methods.name: error
methods.description: Used to log Errors to the console.

methods.name: warn
methods.description: Used to log Warnings to the console.

methods.name: info
methods.description: Used to log Info Messages to the console.

methods.name: ok
methods.description: Used to log Success Messages to the console.

methods.name: progress
methods.description: Used to log Progress Related Messages to the console.

props.name: name
props.description: The Real/Online name of the Author.

props.name: username
props.description: The Discord Username of the Author.

props.name: email
props.description: The E-Mail address of the Author.

props.name: name
props.description: The Name of the Bot.

props.name: version
props.description: The Current Version of the Bot.

props.name: author
props.description: Information about the Author.

props.name: type
props.description: Whether the Cooldowns should be applied per command or not.

props.name: systemCooldown
props.description: If cooldowns.type is "system" then, this is the duration of the cooldown.

props.name: token
props.description: The Token of the Bot used to Login

props.name: prefixes
props.description: The Array of Prefixes the bot uses. The first item is considered the Main Prefix, others are considered alternative prefixes.

props.name: reportErrors
props.description: Whether even the smallest of errors should be reported to the Discord User or not.

props.name: cooldowns
props.description: Determines how cooldowns should be applied in the bot.

props.name: commandsDirectory
props.description: The Directory where the Bot should scan for Command Files.

props.name: info
props.description: Some Optional but Useful information about the bot.

props.name: custom
props.description: Used to Declare Custom Properties that are held in the bot object.

props.name: name
props.description: The Extensive Name of the command.

props.name: description
props.description: Short Description of the command.

props.name: syntax
props.description: The Basic Usage of the Command.

props.name: name
props.description: The Name of the Argument. This is used to access this argument later in the run() method.

props.name: type
props.description: The Type of the Argument.
